Mathar_, Nov 27 2008]If p[i]=fibonacci(2i-4) and if A is the Hessenberg matrix of order n defined by: A[i,j]=p[j-i+1], (i<=j), A[i,j]=-1, (i=j+1), and A[i,j]=0 otherwise. Then, for n>=1, a(n-1)= det A. [From _Milan Janjic_, May 08 2010]a(n) = (2*sqrt(3)-3)/6*(1+sqrt(3))^n - (2*sqrt(3)+3)/6*(1-sqrt(3))^n. - Sergei N. Gladkovskii, Jul 18 2012
